--- title: "To do before the first class" subtitle: Download softwares, create project and create data table fontsize: 1.5em linkcolor: grey callout-appearance: simple author: "Karen Cristine Goncalves" date: "2023-08-1" font-family: serif autosize: false categories: - R basics format: revealjs: transition: none theme: dark scrollable: true editor: visual incremental: false echo: true message: false warning: false slide-number: true --- ```{=html} ``` ## First things first, download and install: - R software - Windows - [R 4.3.1](https://cloud.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/R-4.3.1-win.exe) - [Rtools](https://cloud.r-project.org/bin/windows/Rtools/rtools43/rtools.html) - MacOS - [R 4.3.1](https://cloud.r-project.org/bin/macosx/big-sur-arm64/base/R-4.3.1-arm64.pkg) - If you use Linux - [select the right type](https://cloud.r-project.org/bin/linux/) and follow the instructions there (open the terminal and paste the codes) - RStudio - [Windows](https://download1.rstudio.org/electron/windows/RStudio-2023.06.1-524.exe) - [MacOS 11+](https://download1.rstudio.org/electron/macos/RStudio-2023.06.1-524.dmg) - [Ubuntu 20 or 22/Debian 11](https://download1.rstudio.org/electron/jammy/amd64/rstudio-2023.06.1-524-amd64.deb) - [Fedora 19/RedHat 7](https://download1.rstudio.org/electron/centos7/x86_64/rstudio-2023.06.1-524-x86_64.rpm) - For other operating systems, visit [posit.co](https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/) ## Create a project named `"R_classes"` By creating a project, you can be sure that your input and output will all be in the same folder (called a directory in programming) ### Follow one of the tutorials below to create a project: - [Watch the following video to see how to create a project](media/Create_project.mp4) - [Follow the instructions here](https://intro2r.com/rsprojs.html) - if you are lazy like me, just look at the figures in the article ## Prepare the working directory (project folder) Create 4 folders in the project folder 1. Inputs 2. Outputs 3. Plots 4. Scripts ::: callout-caution Note: try not to use non-english symbols, spaces or dashes (`"-"`) in file or folder names ::: ## Prepare the input table {.smaller} If you have data you wish to work on (be it: fluorescence measured in FACS or microplate, concentration of protein, OD of bacteria/algae, gene expression levels), prepare the table as follows: ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
SampleA_rep1 SampleA_rep2 SampleA_rep3 SampleB_rep1 SampleB_rep2 SampleB_rep3
Measurement_1 value value value value value value
Measurement_2 value value value value value value
Measurement_3 value value value value value value
Measurement_4 value value value value value value
Measurement_5 value value value value value value
Measurement_6 value value value value value value
````` ::: Where: > - SampleA/SampleB are the different treatments and rep_1/2/3 are the biological replicates > - Measurement1/2/3/4/5/6 are the proteins/genes measured (several repetitions of the same assay go one per line) > - If you have nothing, [click here to download an example dataset](exampleData/Class1_exampleData.txt) > - Save the table in excel as `*.txt` (text; tab-delimited) in the `Input` folder

<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
